p: In 2017, the National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB) and Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK), with support from the United Nation Development Program (UNDP), launched the DRR and CCA convergence framework. This relatively new framework proposes DRR and CCA convergence in five different dimensions: policy, institution, budget, project management, and methodology [ 140]. Even though this convergence framework exists, it has been reported that multi-sector coordination at the local level remains an issue. Weak leadership is the factor behind ineffective coordination between different stakeholders at local levels. This reflects that a policy framework for integration will not be functional without effective leadership to facilitate the collaboration [ 122].
